newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: MAN plans to raise '97 Yugo sales 50 pct - Tanjug.
newsitem.headline: MAN plans to raise '97 Yugo sales 50 pct - Tanjug.

text.p: Germany's truck manufacturer MAN plans to sell 300 vehicles on the Yugoslav market this year, or 50 percent more than in 1996, the official Yugoslav news agency Tanjug reported on Tuesday.

"The vehicles are sold to buyers on credit for up to three years, with 30 percent down payment and interest of 19 percent, or 6.3 percent on an annual level," Sveta Todorovic, owner of Belgrade firm STM, MAN's general representative for Yugoslavia, was quoted by Tanjug as saying.
MAN presented its entire programme at the Belgrade Car Show, including its heavy tow trucks with the EURO-2 engines, the biggest in their category in Europe.
